publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6458.1 Kenneth Gibson: Bursary Cuts at James Watt College—As an amendment to motion (S3M-6458) in the name of Duncan McNeil, insert at end "; is very concerned that the cut in bursary funds will come at only two weeks’ notice to the poorest further education students; notes that further education students are currently reliant on a discretionary-based support system; supports NUS Scotland’s calls to reform the current bursary fund system to ensure that the system provides an acceptable minimum level of support that will last until the end of the course, and urges James Watt College, the Scottish Funding Council and the Scottish Government to find a solution to reverse the cut facing James Watt College students." Supported by: Anne McLaughlin*, Michael Matheson*
S3M-6458.1 Bursary Cuts at James Watt College (lodged on 2 June 2010) Aileen Campbell*, Rob Gibson*, Sandra White*
